Member Function Documentation

int CFlexList::getNumEntries ( )
 

Returns the number of entries in the list

CListEntry * CFlexList::getEntry ( int index )
 

Returns a pointer to the entry with index <index>

void CFlexList::appendEntry ( CListEntry * entry )
 

Adds this entry to the end of the list

void CFlexList::insertEntry ( CListEntry * entry,
int index )
 

New entry will be inserted into the list at the given index. All entries with that index and greater will be shifted down by one (their indices will increase by one). If you insert past either end of the array, the insertion will occur at the end (element 0 or element d_numElements)

void CFlexList::removeEntry ( int index )
 

Remove the pointer of the entry at this index. Compact the array. The CFlexList destructor is NOT called.

void CFlexList::deleteEntry ( int index )
 

Remove the pointer to the entry at this index and free the memory of the entry by calling the CFlexList destructor

void CFlexList::removeAllEntries ( )
 

Remove all of the entries of the array. Does NOT call the elements' destructors.

void CFlexList::deleteAllEntries ( )
 

Removes all of the entries from the array and deletes them (calls their destructors.

void CFlexList::setVisibilityOn ( int index )
 

void CFlexList::setVisibilityOff ( int index )
 

int CFlexList::isVisibilityOn ( int index )
 

If an item is visible, it is displayed in the list. If not, the item is skipped

int CFlexList::hasListChanged ( )
 

Returns 1 if the list has changed since the last call of resetListChangedFlag

void CFlexList::resetListChangedFlag ( )
 

Resets an internal flag that indicates list changes. This flag is set by any changes to the list (new entries, removing entries, changed order)

void CFlexList::update ( )
 

Update all entries of the list. The updateWidgets method of each entry is called

void CFlexList::selectEntry ( int index )
 

void CFlexList::unselectEntry ( int index )
 

int CFlexList::isEntrySelected ( int index )
 

Selects, unselects an entry and determines if an entry is selected If an entry is selected, it is highlighted by changing its appearance (how is defined in the CListEntry class)

void CFlexList::exclusiveSelectEntry ( int index )
 

Selects an entry and deselects all other entries

void CFlexList::selectAllEntries ( )
 

void CFlexList::unselectAllEntries ( )
 

void CFlexList::setScrollPosition ( int index )
 

int CFlexList::getScrollPosition ( )
 

The position is the index of the first entry visible in the list (top entry)

void CFlexList::setScrollSpeed ( int scrollRepeatTime,
int scrollStep )
 

Sets the speed of the automatic scrolling when the user moves the mouse cursor to the upper or lower end of the list. The repeat time is specified in ms and determines the time rate of scrolling, while scrollStep determines the shift at each time

void CFlexList::getVirtualSize ( int & width,
int & height )
 

void CFlexList::addTitle ( char * title,
int sortingEnabled = 0 )
 

Adds a widget to the titlebar

void CFlexList::removeAllTitles ( )
 

Removes all widgets from the titlebar

void CFlexList::setTitlebarOn ( )
 

void CFlexList::setTitlebarOff ( )
 

int CFlexList::isTitleBarOn ( )
 

If the titlebar is on, it is displayed on top of the list with all entries added by addTitle

void CFlexList::setTitleFont ( char * titleFont )
 

Sets the font for the titles

int CFlexList::getTitleBarExtentHeight ( )
 

Returns the height of the title bar

int CFlexList::getColumnWidth ( int columnNum )
 

void CFlexList::setColumnWidth ( int columnNum,
int width )
 

The column width determines the width of the titlebar widgets and the widgh of the list entry widgets

void CFlexList::setColumnToMinimalWidth ( int columnNum,
int distance = 0 )
 

Sets a column to the minimum required width, that is the size that all widgets in this column are displayed completely and there is a space of size <distance> between the column

void CFlexList::setAllColumnsToMinimalWidth ( int distance = 0 )
 

Sets all columns to their minimal width

void CFlexList::sortList ( int column )
 

Sorts the list by a certain column

void CFlexList::enableSorting ( int column )
 

void CFlexList::disableSorting ( int column )
 

Enables or disables the sorting feature when the user clicks on the title

void CFlexList::setDraggingOn ( )
 

void CFlexList::setDraggingOff ( )
 

int CFlexList::isDraggingOn ( )
 

If dragging is on, the user can drag selected items to a new position, which will re-order the list
